discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The most effective method to capture high-priority opportunities identified during quantitative risk analysis is to establish a contingency reserve. Contingency reserves are typically set aside to address both threats and opportunities in project risk management. For opportunities, reserves allow the project to take advantage of favorable events by allocating resources, time, or budget proactively to exploit or enhance those opportunities.
